discussion_comments.comment_body:
https://zod.dev/library-authors

With zod 4.0.x released last week, this line needs to be modified slightly to include version four releases.

`"zod": "^3.25.0 || ^4.0.0"`

This value also needs to be set for devDependencies too.
A bit annoying for npm users when this version is not 4. Is there any discussion or issue that is attempting to update this?
this should not be necessary as it is a dep of `@tanstack/react-router`

You are right that, this is not needed in default `npm` setup, but it is necessary in the setup our company and others like it could be using: 

`@tanstack/react-router-devtools` requires `@tanstack/router-core` as a **peer** and if you use a stricter dependency manager like `pnpm` it means that the implicit dependencies of `@tanstack/react-router` are **not shared** with the rest of your dependencies, a.k.a. `@tanstack/react-router-devtools` doesn't have access to the dependencies of `@tanstack/router-core`.

This is meaningful and intentional for portability, so that developers need to declare what dependencies they use, and not be able to import some implicit dependency of a dependency.

Does it make sense? I can try to rephrase if i wasn't able to express very well.
change to absolute version number, so codesandbox etc. can install
Thanks! I went ahead and updated.

For some reason adding the workos example was breaking CI for this project. Testing locally, adding a vite version here fixed it 🤷‍♂️

Happy to investigate further if this isn't the right call, but just wanted to explain why I added a change in this package.

Thanks. I think I might also have formulated myself too vaguely - it's common for examples to have versions with carets like "^2.1.1" - you can compare with existing ones, we just can't have "workspace:*".
It's work perfectly fine to add the vite version here.

This shouldn't be needed, since Vitest gets inherited from the monorepo. Plus we don't have vitest as deps or devDeps in any of the other packages.

Its probably whats causing the lockfile failure in CI.
Hmm. It was failing to run the tests locally without it.

Oh, I see!!!

This tends to happen for me locally as well when I haven't kept up to date with the **lockfile** on _main_ or if my pnpm version isn't in sync with `packageManager` field in the `package.json` file.

Some common indicators of happening which I've noted are:
- local tests suddenly thinks vitest is missing
  - for which "fixing" it causes CI installs to fail
- local formatting using prettier causes unrelated files or areas of affected code to change their code-style.
- local builds failings with nx being unable to build one or more packages.
- local builds start getting interrupted by unrelated/unexpected eslint violations.

To fix this, I often switch to _main_ and pull down all the latest changes. Then make sure the pnpm version is correct and run `pnpm install`. Then for good measure, I run `pnpm dedupe`.

commented_code:
+{
+  "name": "@tanstack/router-arktype-adapter",
+  "version": "1.45.11",
+  "description": "Modern and scalable routing for React applications",
+  "author": "Tanner Linsley",
+  "license": "MIT",
+  "repository": {
+    "type": "git",
+    "url": "https://github.com/TanStack/router.git",
+    "directory": "packages/router-arktype-adapter"
+  },
+  "homepage": "https://tanstack.com/router",
+  "funding": {
+    "type": "github",
+    "url": "https://github.com/sponsors/tannerlinsley"
+  },
+  "keywords": [
+    "react",
+    "location",
+    "router",
+    "routing",
+    "async",
+    "async router",
+    "typescript"
+  ],
+  "scripts": {
+    "clean": "rimraf ./dist && rimraf ./coverage",
+    "test:eslint": "eslint ./src",
+    "test:types": "pnpm run \"/^test:types:ts[0-9]{2}$/\"",
+    "test:types:ts50": "node ../../node_modules/typescript50/lib/tsc.js",
+    "test:types:ts51": "node ../../node_modules/typescript51/lib/tsc.js",
+    "test:types:ts52": "node ../../node_modules/typescript52/lib/tsc.js",
+    "test:types:ts53": "node ../../node_modules/typescript53/lib/tsc.js",
+    "test:types:ts54": "node ../../node_modules/typescript54/lib/tsc.js",
+    "test:types:ts55": "tsc",
+    "test:unit": "vitest",
+    "test:unit:dev": "pnpm run test:unit --watch --typecheck",
+    "test:build": "publint --strict",
+    "build": "vite build"
+  },
+  "type": "module",
+  "types": "dist/esm/index.d.ts",
+  "main": "dist/cjs/index.cjs",
+  "module": "dist/esm/index.js",
+  "exports": {
+    ".": {
+      "import": {
+        "types": "./dist/esm/index.d.ts",
+        "default": "./dist/esm/index.js"
+      },
+      "require": {
+        "types": "./dist/cjs/index.d.cts",
+        "default": "./dist/cjs/index.cjs"
+      }
+    },
+    "./package.json": "./package.json"
+  },
+  "sideEffects": false,
+  "files": [
+    "dist",
+    "src"
+  ],
+  "engines": {
+    "node": ">=12"
+  },
+  "devDependencies": {
+    "@testing-library/jest-dom": "^6.4.6",
+    "@testing-library/react": "^16.0.0",
+    "@tanstack/react-router": "workspace:*",
+    "arktype": "^2.0.0-beta.2"
+  },
+  "peerDependencies": {
+    "@tanstack/react-router": ">=1.43.2"

discussion_comments.comment_body:
should we also add `arktype` as peer dependency to express compatibility with some version?
e.g. what happens if the internal structure of arktype changes as of some version?

commented_code:
+{
+  "author": "Casey Johnson (https://github.com/theMostCuriousHomunculus)",
+  "name": "tanstack-router-react-example-ssr-fastify-trpc",
+  "private": true,
+  "sideEffects": false,
+  "type": "module",
+  "scripts": {
+    "build": "pnpm run build:client && pnpm run build:server",
+    "build:client": "vite build --outDir ../../dist/client --ssrManifest",
+    "build:server": "vite build --outDir ../../dist/server --ssr ../server/index.ts --target esnext",
+    "check": "tsc -p src/server/tsconfig.check.json && tsc -p src/client/tsconfig.check.json",
+    "dev": "nodemon src/server/index.ts --dev",
+    "routegen": "tsr generate",
+    "start": "node index.js"
+  },
+  "dependencies": {
+    "@fastify/vite": "^6.0.7",
+    "@tanstack/react-query": "^5.51.16",
+    "@tanstack/react-router": "workspace:*",

discussion_comments.comment_body:
Just set it to whatever is the latest version ATM. You can get these from the package.json fields. So don't refer to them as __"workspace:*"__.

pnpm locally uses the overrides to use the local version and when deployed our CI automatically changes these versions.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
The packages shouldn't be workspace prefixed.

`"^1.46.3"`
